title: Vengeance on Varos
dialogue_triumphs: Much self-aware discussion between Arak and Etta: 'When did they last show something worth watching...?' 'Last week.' 'That was a repeat.'
dialogue_disasters: A round of applause for that old favourite 'We must act'.
The terrible pun at the end: 'I think he needs more than water, Peri, eh?'
goofs: The cuffs lock around the Governor's wrists at different moments in the first two votes that we see.
How can the TARDIS so suddenly run out of something so vital?
Why are the cannibals wearing nappies?
Both the desert and the water are illusions, but the desert parches whereas the water doesn't quench.

future_history: Varos is set almost three centuries in Peri's future, likely between 2285 and 2320.
untold_adventures: The Doctor got lost twice in the TARDIS corridors
The Doctor wiped the memory of the flight computer
The Doctor jettisoned three-quarters of the storage hold
additional_notes: The episode features a grim parody of TV viewing, complete with repeats and punch-in appreciation figures, and a graphic attack on video nasties.
bottom_line: A grim parody of TV viewing with some problematic elements, including the Doctor's character degeneration and the display of violence and voyeurism. The ending is praised: 'We're free.' 'Are we?' 'Yes.' 'What shall we do?' 'Dunno.'
